text:
A borrower can have multiple debt issues that vary not only by maturities and coupons
but also by credit rating. Issue credit ratings depend on the seniority of a bond issue and
its covenants. Notching is the practice by rating agencies of assigning different ratings to
bonds of the same issuer. Notching is based on several factors, including seniority of the
bonds and its impact on potential loss severity.
